titleStmt.title: Letter from Edward C. Lambert to John G. Neihardt, April 22, 1970
titleStmt.author: Lambert, Edward C.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Edward C. Lambert to John G. Neihardt, April 22, 1970

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw:
University of Missouri - Columbia SIGILL UNIVERSITATIS MISSOURIEN MDCCCXXXIX
100 Neff Hall Columbia, Mo. 65201 Telephone 314-449-8189
SCHOOL OF JOURNALISM
div1.p: I was indeed delighted to hear from you and to learn that Mr. Thompson is involved in preparing more of your records. I did indeed have a letter from him yesterday.

I am happy to hear that you are in good health and that you are making progress on your autobiography. I am delighted, too, to learn that Black Elk Speaks is having such a fine sale both here and abroad.

I find I have only one tape in my files. This was Missouri Forum that I did with you and I had the late Dean Mott, Dr. Loren Reid, and Dean Earl English on my panel. I certainly would be happy to make that tape available to Mr. Thompson so that he could copy it. Meanwhile, I shall suggest that he contact the Missouri State Historical Society. I am sure they have a number of video tapes over there.
Also, I shall put him in touch with Mr. Don Mitchell, Director of Instructional Television. Mr. Mitchell of course has control of your video tape lectures. It is always good to hear from you.

closer.note: Edward C. Lambert Assistant to the Chancellor in Charge of Television
